publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1363# Scott Barrie: Let's Keep It Safe-That the Parliament notes the widespread harassment that people with learning difficulties can be subjected to in Scotland; further notes the work undertaken by MENCAP and ENABLE to highlight this problem; congratulates Values Into Action for producing the A to Z booklets Let's Keep It Safe and Let's Report It to assist people in dealing with and overcoming such bullying and harassment; further notes the successful launch of these booklets in Edinburgh on 15 November 2000, and commends them to local authorities, NHS Trusts and voluntary groups as a guide to best practice in this area.
S1M-1363# Let's Keep It Safe (lodged on 15 November 2000) Mr Kenneth Gibson*

S1M-1363# Scott Barrie: Let's Keep It Safe-That the Parliament notes the widespread harassment that people with learning difficulties can be subjected to in Scotland; further notes the work undertaken by MENCAP and ENABLE to highlight this problem; congratulates Values Into Action for producing the A to Z booklets Let's Keep It Safe and Let's Report It to assist people in dealing with and overcoming such bullying and harassment; further notes the successful launch of these booklets in Edinburgh on 15 November 2000, and commends them to local authorities, NHS Trusts and voluntary groups as a guide to best practice in this area. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson
S1M-1363# Let's Keep It Safe (lodged on 15 November 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-1363# Let's Keep It Safe (lodged on 15 November 2000) Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Alex Neil*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1363# Let's Keep It Safe (lodged on 15 November 2000) Cathy Jamieson*, Johann Lamont*, Dr Elaine Murray*
S1M-1363# Let's Keep It Safe (lodged on 15 November 2000) Maureen Macmillan*, Rhoda Grant*, Nora Radcliffe*, Elaine Smith*

S1M-1363# Scott Barrie: Let's Keep It Safe—That the Parliament notes the widespread harassment that people with learning difficulties can be subjected to in Scotland; further notes the work undertaken by MENCAP and ENABLE to highlight this problem; congratulates Values Into Action for producing the A to Z booklets Let’s Keep It Safe and Let’s Report It to assist people in dealing with and overcoming such bullying and harassment; further notes the successful launch of these booklets in Edinburgh on 15 November 2000, and commends them to local authorities, NHS Trusts and voluntary groups as a guide to best practice in this area. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Alex Neil, Linda Fabiani, Cathy Jamieson, Johann Lamont, Dr Elaine Murray, Maureen Macmillan, Rhoda Grant, Nora Radcliffe, Elaine Smith
S1M-1363# Let's Keep It Safe (lodged on 15 November 2000) Cathy Peattie*, Christine Grahame*, Shona Robison*
S1M-1363# Let's Keep It Safe (lodged on 15 November 2000) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-1363# Let's Keep It Safe (lodged on 15 November 2000) Irene McGugan*

S1M-1363# Scott Barrie: Let's Keep It Safe-That the Parliament notes the widespread harassment that people with learning difficulties can be subjected to in Scotland; further notes the work undertaken by MENCAP and ENABLE to highlight this problem; congratulates Values Into Action for producing the A to Z booklets Let's Keep It Safe and Let's Report It to assist people in dealing with and overcoming such bullying and harassment; further notes the successful launch of these booklets in Edinburgh on 15 November 2000, and commends them to local authorities, NHS Trusts and voluntary groups as a guide to best practice in this area. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Alex Neil, Linda Fabiani, Cathy Jamieson, Johann Lamont, Dr Elaine Murray, Maureen Macmillan, Rhoda Grant, Nora Radcliffe, Elaine Smith, Cathy Peattie, Christine Grahame, Shona Robison, Donald Gorrie, Irene McGugan, Fiona McLeod*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-1363# Let's Keep It Safe (lodged on 15 November 2000) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-1363# Let's Keep It Safe (lodged on 15 November 2000) Irene Oldfather*, Ms Sandra White*
